item.title: Eternal Crusade Promo Art: Abaddon The Despoiler
item.description:
Pin-It
ETERNAL CRUSADE
www.eternalcrusade.com/ &…;

++++++++++++++++++++++
Illustration © Games Workshop / BHVR
Special thanks to Creative Director David Ghosland, Art Director Ghislain Barbe and Producer Mathieu Fecteau and Narrative Designer Ivan Mulkeen
++++++++++++++++++++++

I'm going to start by saying I was wondering why this piece was seemingly taking a bit longer than expected to be released (and I'm not saying I am privy to the new schedule nor motives) but when Mad Max: Fury Road opened- it seemed to make perfect sense to my inner fanboy It was just so inspiring to remember these two titanic IPs, which obviously borrow from common ground,  given a "blood transfusion" and reawakened in fantastic new ways and methods not available in the past.

Call me a bit of an optimist but the concept of "failing upwards" is strongly aligned with my personal world view, and maybe why I never quite understood the whole "failbaddon" concept?

Sure, I get the black comedy and the hint at incompetence, but what other entity has united and commanded the uncountable, dysfunctional, maligned psychos of Chaos and takes them to the gates of the Imperium? What doesn't kill the guy is bound to make him stronger at least in some way, right? That tenacity and unbroken spirit is what makes him a force to be reckoned with, as opposed to a porcelain hero that has never been chipped before. The first time you fall is often the hardest, and you get used to it, and after a certain point when all you have is nothing, the only way left is up. Is there something I'm missing?

Anyways:

- I had particularly great fun adapting Drach'nyen into a form that was seemingly vulgar and functional at the same time. The faces of victims of [hopefully] familiar races materialising and morphing across its blade.

- This one had a pretty drastic change in lighting setup that I suggested, moreso because I wanted to make him feel more ominous, as though we stood in his shadow as opposed to spotlighting him on some figurative stage. The idea of his outstretched Talon of Horus, along with fresh propellant gases catching the light, almost beckoning us to join him in his next crusade, seemed quite nice in my mind's eye. Of course, the aiming lasers probably suggest you don't have a choice in the matter too so why not!

- Details wise, no where near as fun as Skarblitz, as this was more stressful to keep up with official miniature specs than anything else. I'll defintely be the first to say that making a "tiny" change (read: complete removal) of an inventive detail you put hours thinking about and executing really doesn't help your position or motivation as an Illustrator on a job such as this, not to mention with a character as iconic as this...

- ...but of course that doesn't kill my buzz entirely so I brought back the "latch on" shin plate armour that I designed for him on the Pandorax cover for Black Library  

- Oh and I suppose having a warhound titan as personal retinue ain't too shabby either!


++++++++++++++++++++++

Its certainly been a while since I did 'advertising-grade' work whose amount of brief changes rivals that of theme parks and events... This series (which you will come to see over the following months as part of a ongoing reveal), took a few months to put together. And for me that is one hell of a long time to be 'attached' on a project, one where I play a larger role of illustrator than designer. In my book that is the equivalent of a personal hell, but one that I look back at with pride when I see how far we came from the original brief or the balancing of "IP lore-hound" requirements which I think I needn't have to explain...

In no small way this was thanks to the support and prowess of art director Ghislain Barbe, who pretty much guided me and afforded a wide enough creative berth through it all, at times more of a collaborator than an art director (in the conventional sense). I'll say that I have never been more certain of not wanting his job , and that he has my deepest respect given the creative challenges we had to go through.

The main point I am trying to make, as a kind of "outsider" contractor to this production, is that to all the 40K fans out there, know that you have a team there that is truly committed to delivering what you have loved and will continue to love for a long time to come.

See you on the battlefields Ave Dominus Nox!

    You still may NOT remove my signature from the image or make anychanges in artwork! Keep in mind that if this music is for sale somewhere, then my work can't be used as it's "release cover" without buying license from me.

  • If you are still wondering what it means then: if I find out that someone is selling my stuff as their own or uploads my
    graphics somewhere for free to download, then i will report your site/account to DMCA.
    Which end result will be your site takedown or account deletion.

item.title: Sam + Video
item.description:
Pin-It

Here's the speedpaint! www.youtube.com/watch?v=dv6tPn…



I could have made a reference, fully-rendered, but nooooo... Nope, too lazy today. Especially since those arm sockets are looking at me funny with their asymmetry and all.

I liked drawing Sam and all, but I've always wanted to render him in 3D but don't have the skill/tools necessary at the moment. So, I did the best my 2D rendering skills would allow for now.
It was kind of fun to add some of the extra details, like the cracks, scratched paint/rust, and to "cut" his eyebrows in half to allow him to emote more, should I draw him like this again...
My favorite bit, though, was the shape I gave him on his jaw piece and the bottom of his head piece. The head piece is curved downward and the mouth piece is curved upward so that he has a smile/smirk without a thousand itty bitty mechanical pieces. Makes him look cute, especially with the eyelids.

On another note, I finished high school today. Onto college, yippee. So, I guess you could call this a semi-celebratory deal.

item.title: NEO JAPAN 2202 - Yuto Ishii
item.description:
Pin-It
Really wanted to do some Neo Japan stuffs ever since I got back from Tokyo recently, but currently catching up with all the works I've missed so I only manage to sketch this guy today :/
Yuto is one of the characters I have been developing recently, I'm currently writing the whole script and decided that I need a good+bad guy! He's gonna be an important role to Kazuko.

Heres the lore:

Yuto Ishii, also known as "Seven (7)" by most people, is one of the more wanted terrorist on the list. Yuto Ishii is formerly a prisoner in Hikari Maximum Security Prison, Yamaguchi, he was said to be a subject of a newly founded project that focuses on the psychological behavior of an inmate.
 
All the test subjects are only referred/called by their numbers instead of names, also to avoid a trigger of unnecessary memories. Yuto Ishii is known as 'Seven', the 7th patient in the first batch of the project. Yuto was an inmate on a death row, his conviction is a first degree murder of his parents, and an attempted murder on his brother, he pleaded guilty and though he was proven to be a mentally ill individual, he was still given a death sentence. He was also the only surviving patient from the first batch up until his escape, of all 26 subjects, 20 died of shock/trauma/heart failures, 3 suicide by biting their own tongue, and 2 shot on an attempted escape, the duration of the test lasted 6 years.

Yuto Ishii was considered a successful test subject as he has shown absolutely 0% of violent thoughts/behavior, his personality has also changed to a timid young and peaceful man, he has no memories of his traumatic childhood or previous crimes, the most surprising result is that his IQ has raised significantly, he was able to solve extremely difficult questions and his reaction speeds are almost tripled. Researches concluded that this is a direct result from the tests and they have increase the maximum potential of his brain. However, Yuto Ishii miraculously disappeared overnight on the winter of 2196, it was concluded that he has somehow escaped and the helmet on him was untrackable.

In the year 2199, a mysterious figure started appearing throughout tokyo and goes by the name "Seven", a vigilante that has sacked several drug dealers. But he was often seen talking to himself all the time, and has a few robotic limbs that seemingly acts on its own, as if the extra limbs belong to another person. Rumors has it that the 'psychotic' seven controls the limbs, and the 'genius' seven controls the main body. He has been seen with extra ordinary speed, and seems to be able to avoid bullets (unproven), as often as he appears, he has not once been detected by the local police.


Hopefully I can get some time to finished up this sketch and render him out!

Other Neo Japan pieces

item.title: The Siren
item.description:
Pin-It
I'm on holiday, so I sat down to finish some work of my own! Yet another painting in my 'monstergirls v2' series The mermaid, turned Siren. 

The Greek Sirens; (beautiful) half-bird ladies that lure sailors and pirates to their death with their enchanting voices and songs, causing the poor men to shipwreck as they sail closer to find the woman to whom this phenomenal voice would belong.

I mixed it up a little (accidentally) and gave a mermaid this Greek mythological background without knowing it was wrong. It was pointed out that this is in fact a mermaid, and not a siren, but I figured she might as well so the same evil where she climbs on a cliff, utilizes her human vocal cords to shipwreck thirsty sailors and then bathe in the sunken treasures afterward. Because why the hell not nothing says I can't make my own versions! I like it better like this anyway xD. 
And this dear Mermaid with the Siren profession treasures both her victims and their belongings a lot. 


--------------- *GASP* ------------
OMG IS THIS MY SECOND DD?! IS IT REALLY?!?! D; 
Thank you so muuuuuch IIngo for the suggestion! And anyone else that did but didn't get mentioned in the DD box ;o 
I don't know how to smart link to someone's profile so I'mma just regular link it like a noob, but Iingo makes cute stuff ^_^  iingo.deviantart.com/
This makes me so happy ;___; <33

item.title: Kenno - Atherling MYO
item.description:
Pin-It
The MYO Aetherling Contest!!So I've been planning this for some months now, and thought I'd finally introduce the first (and most likely only) Make Your Own Aetherling event!!
Read below for all the details! It features some great prizes and lots of opportunities for everyone to enter! <3


(Banner image featuring Darkling the primal aetherling, as well as Ringo!)
Community Group:
:iconthe-aetherie:
Species Database:
http://aetherlings.weebly.com/
What is an aetherling?
Aetherlings are small, enchanted creatures that live from the thousands of essences found in the natural world. Each individual is born from a single piece of nature, which the aetherling depends on to provide them with life-giving energy. Through the crystals growing on their bodies, aetherlings absorb the energy from the essence of their birth, and may carry or distribute this essence throughout their world. Canonically, they make the

Fell totally in love with these things, their lore and history and world is amazing. ;; 3 ;; wanted to try making my own. Augh I am dead tired tho so I the quality of text may vary. 
I wish Best of a luck for others taking part in MYO ;; O ;;


Character Info

Name >> Kenno 
Nicknames >> Keno, Kimi, Kimalainen, Mehiläinen, Mehi, Meh.
Essence >>  Honey
Element >>  Earth   | Water 
Traits >> Common Aetherling.  

Personality & "History"

Kenno, even if kindhearted, is most and first of all very self-centered being. Not that he is too egoistic, but in situation where he is forced to make decision of saving himself (and his honey) or someone random, he chooses himself... and the honey. Lucky enough he seldom ends up being in situations like those and mostly he just laughs at every misfortune until it really is killing him. That side of him sure is killer since he just CAN'T take anything seriously and his calmness may even disturb someone who really is in need of comfort. Mellifluous laughter may fill every corner of his lodging when ever it is really a good or a bad situation. From the heart he is not a spirited traveler but he does go places now and then, mostly because he is tempted on learning about different kind of honeys and how bees work even if he is not forced to move anywhere. Speaking of honey, it truly is this aetherlings everything. He uses it as a life force yes, but also in baking, cooking and even for better looks. Wondering where he learned such thing? Kenno has been living near humans from the day he was created mostly because his source of essence was tended so well by humans and so he became close with one, offering his gathering skills and crystals to human in exchange of he having part of honey. So happened that he learned how to use honey the most creative ways.  would Kenno consider himself  "domesticated aetherling"? I highly doubt that. In his eyes he is free to come and go as he wants - and to be honest, giving crystals to humans having desire for honey has helped him to get more honey. Maybe he is just lady lucks favorite then? who knows.

Other things worth mentioning 

- Is roughly same size with a small cat.
- Admires bears and their size.
- Loves talking to bees.
- Air near him smells strongly of honey.
- Uses honey for styling his mane and fur and so he is really sticky to touch.
- Licks a lot of his paws and fur after stylishing and so his fur can look a bit spiky and curly.
- Is actually really good at making honey flans and honey - apple cakes.
- Good with human children.
- Doesn't really give a damn what others think of him.
- Doesn't really care for fights between elements and so if the Aetherling approaching him is sane and nice, he doesn't care for their essence nor element.
- He often carries a lot of small bottles or one big including the most finest and pure honey there is.
- His name means honeycomb.
- Speaks with a much more deeper voice than one could expect.
- Loves warm colors


Art and Kenno © Grypwolf 2015
Atherlings © corviture

item.title: Final Fantasy Shiva
item.description:
Pin-It
Shiva from Mobius Final Fantasy a mobile RPG recently released in Japan.

Typically artists complain how they're constrained while working on established series yet Square opted for full carte blanche here. They basically said we need Shiva for that new final fantasy game and we'd like to see what you'd come up with.

You can get more info on MOBIUS FF via official website: www.jp.square-enix.com/MOBIUSF…
